get.description: Firewall monitors and controls incoming and outgoing network traffic based on predefined security rules. It protects against unauthorized access, cyberattacks, and malicious threats. Firewall is superset of several of its submodules which all together help in keeping traffic secure.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaFirewall_FirewallSchema.description: Firewall monitors and controls incoming and outgoing network traffic based on predefined security rules. It protects against unauthorized access, cyberattacks, and malicious threats. Firewall is superset of several of its submodules which all together help in keeping traffic secure.

allow-tri-session.description: Allows three-way session when performing destination NAT. This option should be enabled when the managed device is not the default gateway for wireless clients and the default gateway is behind the managed device. This option is typically used for captive portal configuration.

amsdu.description: Aggregated Medium Access Control Service Data Units (AMSDU) packets are dropped if this option is enabled

attack-rate.description: List of attack-rate protocol, rate and action configurations. Sets rates which, if exceeded, can indicate a denial of service attack.

x-enumDescriptions.ARP: Monitor/police ARP attack (non Gratuitous ARP). Default rate 100
x-enumDescriptions.GRAT_ARP: Monitor/police Gratuitous ARP attack. Default rate 50

protocol.x-typeDescription: Protocol to monitor for ipv4 Denial of Service attacks.
protocol.description: Protocol to monitor for Denial of Service attacks.

rate.description: Number of requests per 30 seconds. Valid range 1-16384

x-enumDescriptions.DENYLIST: Add the session to the deny list.

action.description: Action to take on violation of rate

bwcontracts-subnet-broadcast.description: Apply bandwidth contracts to local subnet broadcast traffic

cp-bandwidth-contract.description: Configures a list of Control-Path bandwidth contract traffic rate limits, in packets per second, to prevent denial of service attacks.

x-enumDescriptions.AUTH: Rate limit traffic to the AUTH process
x-enumDescriptions.IKE: Rate limit IKE traffic to Control Plane
x-enumDescriptions.L2_OTHER: Rate limit L2 protocol and L2 special handling traffic
x-enumDescriptions.ROUTE: Rate limit traffic that needs ARP requests generated
x-enumDescriptions.SESSMIRR: Rate limit session mirrored traffic to Control Plane
x-enumDescriptions.VRRP: Rate limit VRRP traffic to Control Plane

protocol.x-typeDescription: Protocol type whose contract is being specified
protocol.description: Protocol type whose contract is being specified

items.description: MAC address of the wired server

items.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.
items.description: IP address of the wired server

deny-needfrag-df-gre.description: Drops IP packets with DF bit set when packet length is greater than GRE tunnel MTU and an ICMP error message is not sent.

deny-needfrag-df-gre-xmit-icmp.description: Drops IP packets with DF bit set when packet length is greater than GRE tunnel MTU and an ICMP error message is sent.

deny-needfrag-df-ipsec.description: Drops IP packets with DF bit set when packet length is greater than IPsec tunnel MTU and an ICMP error message is not sent.

deny-needfrag-gre.description: Drops IP packets when packet length is greater than GRE tunnel MTU and an ICMP error message is not sent

deny-needfrag-gre-xmit-icmp.description: Drops IP packets when packet length is greater than GRE tunnel MTU and an ICMP error message is sent.

deny-source-routing.description: Disallow forwarding of IP frames with source routing options set

dhcp-perf-monitoring.description: Enables DHCP performance monitoring. This parameter is used to measure the time taken for a DHCP exchange.

disable-ftp-server.description: Enables DHCP performance monitoring. This parameter is used to measure the time taken for a DHCP exchange.Enabling this option could cause APs to not boot up. You should not enable this option unless instructed to do so by an Aruba representative. disabled

drop-ip-fragments.description: When enabled, all IP fragments are dropped. You should not enable this option unless instructed to do so by an Aruba representative

enable-bridging.description: Enables bridging when the managed device is in factory default

enable-gre-inner-pkt-frag.description: Enables fragmenting inner IP frames when packet length is greater than GRE tunnel MTU.

enable-per-packet-logging.description: Enables logging of every packet if logging is enabled for the corresponding session rule. Normally, one event is logged per session. If you enable this option, each packet in the session is logged. You should not enable this option unless instructed to do so by an Aruba representative, as doing so may create unnecessary overhead on the managed device.

enable-port-packet-drop-logging.description: Enables port packet logging. If enabled, the dropped frames are logged. Disabled by default

enable-stateful-icmp.description: Enables stateful ICMP processing. This parameter create sessions for ICMP errors and denies unidirectional replies. Disabled by default.

enforce-tcp-handshake.description: Prevents data from passing between two clients until the three-way TCP handshake has been performed. This option should be disabled when you have mobile clients on the network as enabling this option will cause mobility to fail. You can enable this option if there are no mobile clients on the network.

enforce-tcp-sequence.description: Enforces the TCP sequence numbers for all packets. Disabled by default

gre-call-id-processing.description: Creates a unique state for each PPTP tunnel. Do not enable this option unless instructed to do so by a technical support representative.

immediate-feedback.description:
Triggers datapath immediate freeback of buffers.
Applicable to 72xx Platform only(Default disabled)

ip-classification.description:
Enable IP reputation/geolocation classification (Need
to configure IP name server)

local-valid-users.description: Only allow IP addresses of local subnets in user table

log-icmp-error.description: Logs received ICMP errors. You should not enable this option unless instructed to do so by a customer support representative. Disabled by default

maximum-threshold.description: Configures maximum threshold. Requires minimum-threshold to be configured. Range 0-100.

optimize-dad-frames.description:
Optimizes DAD(Duplicate Address Detection) frames on wireless - reduce flooding of
IPv4 gratuitous ARPs/IPv6 DAD frames onto wireless clients. Enabled by default

outstanding-buffers-hwm-percent.description: Outstanding Buffers High Water Mark Percentage(1-99)

prevent-dhcp-exhaustion.description: Enable check for DHCP client hardware address against the packet source MAC address. This command checks the frame's source-MAC against the DHCPv4 client hardware address and drops the packet if it does not match. Enabling this feature prevents a client from submitting multiple DHCP requests with different hardware addresses, thereby preventing DHCP pool depletion.

prohibit-arp-spoofing.description: Detects and prohibits arp spoofing. When this option is enabled, possible arp spoofing attacks are logged and an SNMP trap is sent.

prohibit-ip-spoof-all.description: Detects ARP spoofing, when an intruder sends ARP using the IP and MAC addresses of a known user. When this option is enabled, additional check for the user route cache entry is performed. If the route cache entry is not found or if found, but the route cache entry MAC does not match with the sender MAC in ARP frame, then, the frame is marked as spoof. The IP spoofing attacks are logged and an SNMP trap is sent. If the Prohibit IP Spoofing option is enabled, the controller denies all the traffic from the client using an IP address that is used by another client that has an entry in the user table. This option does not allow multiple MAC addresses to use the same IP address.

prohibit-ip-spoofing.description: Detects IP spoofing (where an intruder sends messages using the IP address of a trusted client). When this option is enabled, source and destination IP and MAC addresses are checked; possible IP spoofing attacks are logged and an SNMP trap is sent. Enabled in IPv4, disabled in IPv6.

prohibit-rc-update.description: This option prohibits route-cache update on user add. Disabled by default.

prohibit-rst-replay.description: Closes a TCP connection in both directions if a TCP RST is received from either direction. You should not enable this option unless instructed to do so by an Aruba representative. Disabled by default

session-idle-timeout.description: Time, in seconds, that a non-TCP session can be idle before it is removed from the session table. You should not modify this option unless instructed to do so by an Aruba representative. Default value is 16. Valid range 16-300

session-spread.description: Enables counter CPU to perform encryption. Applicable to 7200 Series controllers only Disabled by default

session-tunnel-fib.description:
Enable session,tunnel based forwarding. !!Warning!! It
is recommended to toggle this knob during maintenance
window or OFF peak production hours. On M3 this knob
will enable ONLY tunnel based forwarding, session based
does NOT apply to this platform.

shape-mcast.description: Enables multicast optimization and provides excellent streaming quality regardless of the amount of VLANs or IP IGMP groups that are used. Disabled by default.

stall-crash.description: Triggers datapath crash on stall detection. Applies to the to 7200 Series managed device only

track-spoof.description: Detects spoof in datapath. Disabled voip-qos-trusted Prioritizes the RTP traffic based on the DSCP value set by the end user device. NOTE: On enabling, all UCC based ALGs will be disabled. Disabled by default.

voip-wmm-content-enforcement.description: If traffic to or from the user is inconsistent with the associated QoS policy for voice, the traffic is reclassified to best effort and data path counters incremented. This parameter requires the PEFNG license. Disabled by default

wireless-bridge-aging.description: Prevent the age-out of wireless clients when associated to AP. Enabled by default.

tunnel-trusted.description:
Changes the role of incoming tunnel traffic in the inbound firewall role to a permit-all role.
Enabling this parameter allows the AP to be remotely managed through the secured tunnel with the VPN concentrator.

restrict-corp-access.description: Restricted access to the corporate network.

attack-rate.description:
List of attack-rate protocol, rate and action configurations. Sets rates which, if exceeded, can
indicate a denial of service attack.

protocol.x-typeDescription: Protocol to monitor for ipv6 Denial of Service attacks..
protocol.description: Protocol to monitor for Denial of Service attacks.

rate.description: Number of requests per 30 seconds. Valid range 1-16384

ext-hdr-parse-len.description: Set the threshold value beyond which the IPv6 header will not be parsed and the packet will be dropped. Default value 100. Range 100-300

prohibit-rst-replay.description:
Closes a TCP connection in both directions if a TCP RST is
received from either direction. You should not enable this
option unless instructed to do so by a customer support
representative

drop-ip-fragments.description: When enabled, all IP fragments are dropped. You should not enable this option unless instructed to do so by an Aruba representative

enable-per-packet-logging.description: Enables logging of every packet if logging is enabled for the corresponding session rule. Normally, one event is logged per session. If you enable this option, each packet in the session is logged. You should not enable this option unless instructed to do so by an Aruba representative, as doing so may create unnecessary overhead on the managed device.

enable-stateful-icmp.description: Enables stateful ICMP processing. This parameter create sessions for ICMP errors and denies unidirectional replies. Disabled by default.

enforce-tcp-handshake.description: Prevents data from passing between two clients until the three-way TCP handshake has been performed. This option should be disabled when you have mobile clients on the network as enabling this option will cause mobility to fail. You can enable this option if there are no mobile clients on the network.

enforce-tcp-sequence.description: Enforces the TCP sequence numbers for all packets. Disabled by default

prohibit-ip-spoofing.description: Detects IP spoofing (where an intruder sends messages using the IP address of a trusted client). When this option is enabled, source and destination IP and MAC addresses are checked; possible IP spoofing attacks are logged and an SNMP trap is sent. Enabled in IPv4, disabled in IPv6.

flow-offload.description: Configure flow offloading to offload some data processing on AP. By default it's enabled on AOS10, but disabled on AOS8.

ipv6-route-gc-interval.description: Kernel route cache garbage collection interval.

x-enumDescriptions.STABLE_PRIVACY: Generate IPv6 address to Stable Privacy.

ipv6-addr-gen-mode.x-typeDescription: Method for the AP to generate IPv6 address.
ipv6-addr-gen-mode.description: Specifies the method to generate IPv6 address.

Successful200.description: Success response returned from the server.

Error400.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Bad request. Invalid values supplied in request.

Error401.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error403.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error404.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.

Error406.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error408.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error412.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error429.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error500.description: Error details returned from the server.
